words.description: A food made of flour, water, and yeast or another leavening agent, mixed together and baked.
The round fruit of a tree of the rose family, which typically has thin green or red skin and crisp flesh.
A white liquid produced by the mammary glands of mammals.
The flesh of an animal (especially a mammal) as food.
A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins and living wholly in water.
An oval or round object laid by a female bird, reptile, fish, or invertebrate, usually containing a developing embryo.
A swamp grass which is widely cultivated as a source of food, especially in Asia.
A plant or part of a plant used as food.
The sweet and fleshy product of a tree or other plant that contains seed and can be eaten as food.
A sweet crystalline substance obtained from various plants, especially sugar cane and sugar beet, consisting essentially of sucrose.
A white crystalline substance which gives seawater its characteristic taste and is used for seasoning or preserving food.
A dish originally from Italy consisting of dough made from durum wheat and water, extruded or stamped into various shapes and typically cooked in boiling water.
A domestic fowl kept for its eggs or meat, especially a young one.
A pale yellow edible fatty substance made by churning cream and used as a spread or in cooking.
A food made from the pressed curds of milk.
